description: Incident Manager uses engagements to engage contacts and escalation plans during an incident. Use this command to describe the engagement that occurred during an incident.

parameters.name: EngagementId
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement you want the details of.

nested_items.name: ContactArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the escalation plan or contacts involved in the engagement.

nested_items.name: Sender
nested_items.description: The user that started the engagement.

nested_items.name: Subject
nested_items.description: The secure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements to VOICE and EMAIL.

nested_items.name: Content
nested_items.description: The secure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements to VOICE and EMAIL.

nested_items.name: PublicSubject
nested_items.description: The insecure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements to SMS.

nested_items.name: PublicContent
nested_items.description: The insecure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements to SMS.

nested_items.name: IncidentId
nested_items.description: The ARN of the incident in which the engagement occurred.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The time that the engagement started.

nested_items.name: StopTime
nested_items.description: The time that the engagement ended.
